sub_topic: Show that every group of order 60 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C60, the alternating group A5 × C2, or one of the 32 non-abelian groups of order 60.
message_1: How many non-abelian groups of order 60 exist? Can you provide an explicit list of these groups? Also, show that every group of order 60 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C60, the alternating group A5 × C2, or one of these non-abelian groups.

Thus, there are no non-abelian groups in this case.

In conclusion, there is only one non-abelian group of order 60, which we denoted as G_1. Every group of order 60 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C60, the alternating group A5 × C2, or the non-abelian group G_1.
